author: Staff Reporter
text:
First Additional District Judge M. Jothiraman on Friday sentenced a 35-year-old man to undergo life imprisonment for murder and attempt to murder of two persons in 2014.

The prosecution case is that while S. Loganathan (50) of Ambedkar Nagar in Thammampatti was sleeping near a church on June 12, 2014, A. Jayabal, his relative, attacked him with wooden logs. In the impact Loganathan died on the spot.

Jayabal also attacked Loganathan’s brother Samidas and mother Sowriyammal. Both sustained injuries and were hospitalised. Based on a complaint from Loganathan’s brother S. Gandhi, Thammampatti police registered a case under Sections 302 (murder) and 307 (attempt to murder) of IPC.

The police arrested Jayabal. Initially it is said that Jayabal was a mentally challenged person and committed the crime. However, medical examination revealed that he is fit.

The judge also imposed fine of Rs. 3,000. He was later lodged at Salem Central Prison.
title: Man sentenced to life for murder
